alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Butler; Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:50AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Butler, Monroe, north central Baldwin, northeastern Clarke, Wilcox and Conecuh Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 549 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms scattered along a line extending from Thomasville to 5 miles northwest of Frisco City to 6 miles northwest of McCullough. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Thomasville, Evergreen, Camden, Frisco City, Peterman, Georgiana, Uriah, Whatley, Pine Hill, McKenzie, Castleberry, Excel, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Fulton, Repton, Yellow Bluff, Pine Apple and I65 And US 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Butler; Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Wilcox
